name: Low-Sugar Peanut Butter Granola Bars
author: Steven Lee Beatty
summary: These are granola bars made with whole-grain flour, oats, and freshly ground peanut butter as the key ingredients. They're low in fat, but the fat is good fat, and they're low in sugar, which is natural sugar from pure honey.
ingredients: 1 cup mixed dried fruit with no added sugar
½ cup freshly ground peanut butter
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Mix rolled oats, dried fruit, whole wheat flour, salt, and cinnamon together in a large bowl
Whisk peanut butter, oil, honey, egg, and vanilla extract thoroughly in a separate bowl
Pour over oat mixture and mix very well until all the moisture is incorporated
Press evenly into the prepared pan
Bake in the preheated oven until firm, about 20 minutes
Cool completely before removing from the pan and cutting into bars
